cons: Most of the leafy vegetables like Arugula are rich in Oxalic acid, associated with the formation of Kidney stones.
description: This vegetable also an excellent sources of the B-complex group of vitamins such as thiamin, riboflavin, niacin, vitamin B-6 (pyridoxine), and pantothenic acid those are essential for optimum cellular enzymatic and metabolic functions.
It contain healthy levels of vitamin-C. Vitamin-C is a powerful, natural anti-oxidant.
It is one of the excellent vegetable sources for vitamin-K,Vitamin K has a potential role in bone health by promoting osteotropic activity
It is an excellent source of vitamin A,vitamin A and flavonoid compounds in green leafy vegetables help humans protected from skin, lung and oral cavity cancers.
name: Arugula
pros: This vegetable also an excellent sources of the B-complex group of vitamins such as thiamin, riboflavin, niacin, vitamin B-6 (pyridoxine), and pantothenic acid those are essential for optimum cellular enzymatic and metabolic functions.
It contain healthy levels of vitamin-C. Vitamin-C is a powerful, natural anti-oxidant.
It is one of the excellent vegetable sources for vitamin-K,Vitamin K has a potential role in bone health by promoting osteotropic activity
It is an excellent source of vitamin A,vitamin A and flavonoid compounds in green leafy vegetables help humans protected from skin, lung and oral cavity cancers.
Sulfur-containing compound called sulforaphane gives cruciferous vegetables both their bitter taste and their cancer-fighting power.

Leafy greens contain an antioxidant known as alpha-lipoic acid that has been shown to lower glucose levels, increase insulin sensitivity, and prevent oxidative stress-induced changes in patients with diabetes.
